The licence identification number of the facility
The name of the company or person that holds the aquaculture licence for the facility.
The name most commonly used to refer to the aquaculture facility.
The latitude position in decimal degrees of the site location.
The longitude position in decimal degrees of the site location.
General geographic location of the facility. A map of the 10 fish health surveillance zones in DFO Pacific Region can be found at www.pac.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/aquaculture/maps-cartes-eng.html#Fish_Health

Audit Date: Industry average L. salmonis motiles per fish
Lepeophtheirus salmonis is the scientific name for the salmon louse. Motiles refers to female and male preadult and adult stages of the salmon louse. This column shows the average number of motile L. salmonis per farmed salmon examined by industry. From March 1 to June 30, the regulatory threshold is three motiles per fish.

Audit Date: DFO average L. salmonis motiles per fish
Lepeophtheirus salmonis is the scientific name for the salmon louse. Motiles refers to female and male preadult and adult stages of the salmon louse. This column shows the average number of motile L. salmonis per farmed salmon examined by DFO. From March 1 to June 30, the regulatory threshold is three motiles per fish.
Comments include details about the statistical agreement between industry and DFO sea lice counts and indicates if follow-up actions were required.
Year class refers to the amount of time the farmed fish population has spent in seawater. One is less than a year, two is greater than a year.
